intro: Hippocrepis unisiliquosa subsp. biflora, commonly known as the two-flowered rock scabious, is a perennial herb native to parts of southern Europe. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and tall, branched stems. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming from June to August. It thrives in rocky or limestone soils and is often found in dry, sunny habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
